titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Michael Braver Collection of Americanist Material LSC.1585
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2020 December 11.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-21 09:45:52 -0700.

did.unittitle: Michael Braver collection of Americanist material
did.abstract: Collection consists of over 300 speeches by Americanist right-wing extremist spokesmen on reel to reel and cassette tapes, as well as Americanist journals, books, pamphlets, booklets, and fugitive materials. Includes speakers from the John Birch Society, the National Socialist White Peoples' Party, Christian Crusade Convention, and the American Independent Party. Also includes literature from the Christian Anti-Communism Crusade, the Libertarian Party, the Minutemen, Sons of the American Revolution, and Voice of Americanism.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: This collection contains both processed and unprocessed audiovisual materials. Audiovisual materials are not currently available for access, unless otherwise noted in a Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements note at the series and file levels. All requests to access processed audiovisual materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Collection of Americanist material (Collection 1585). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Michael Bruce Braver was born on Sept. 25, 1946 in New York City; AB, MA, UCLA, 1969; MSW, Univ. of Southern CA., 1978; Ph.D, CA School of Professional Psychology, 1983; became asst. professor, Central Washington Univ., 1969-71, winning a meritorious teaching award in 1969; clinical psychologist in private practice, Toluca Lake, CA, beginning in 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of over 300 speeches by Americanist right-wing extremist spokesmen on reel to reel and cassette tapes, as well as Americanist journals, books, pamphlets, booklets, and fugitive materials. Includes speakers from the John Birch Society, the National Socialist White Peoples' Party, Christian Crusade Convention, and the American Independent Party. Also includes literature from the Christian Anti-Communism Crusade, the Libertarian Party, the Minutemen, Sons of the American Revolution, and Voice of Americanism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Many are transcriptions of sermons delivered to the Church of Jesus Christ, Christian in Hollywood, CA. Dr. Swift's sermons are concerned with America, Christianity, and Race. His publisher is the new Christian Crusade Church, P.O. Box 3247, Hollywood, CA 90028 which also publishes The Christian Vanguard, a newspaper of newsletter also concerned with America, Christianity, and Race. In some of the booklets, there is a disclaimer saying that Dr. Swift's Church is not necessarily in complete agreement with the New Christian Crusade Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including speakers sometimes associated with far right causes. Patty Newman ("Pass the Poverty Please"), Harry Tridinoff ("The White Russian"). Gordon Browning (once affiliated with FIPO), Bill Richardson, the CA State Senator affiliated with the Birch Society.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials are available for access. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transcribed from container: The Annual Council Dinner of the John Birch Society held on March 1, 1968 in the Century Plaza Hotel in Los Angeles, CA. Mr. Robert Welch delivered a major address: "If I Were President".

did.unittitle: If I Were President
